item.title: macOS
item.description: macOS Terminal Open a Terminal session and execute the following command, substituting the values for your_private_key.pem and your_host_public_ip with the ones from Step 1. As for the private key, you should have been given an option to download this file when you launched the instance. This command will establish an SSH connection to your server, logging in with the user ec2-user, which is the default on Amazon Linux 2. ssh -i <your_private_key.

item.title: Windows
item.description: Windows PuTTY To log into the EC2 instance from a Windows OS, follow sections “Convert your private key using PuTTYgen” and “Connect to your Linux instance” from these instructions. Use ec2-user for my-instance-user-name in the instructions.
